The '''Revolutionary Socialists''' (RS) are a [[revolutionary socialist]] organisation in [[Egypt]] aligned with the [[International Socialist Tendency]]. The RS produces a newspaper called ''[[The Socialist]]''.<ref name=Revolutionary>{{cite web | url=http://links.org.au/taxonomy/term/537 | title=Revolutionary Socialists (Egypt) | publisher=Links International Journal of Socialist Renewal | accessdate=7 February 2011}}</ref> They claim to have played a criticial role in mobilizing for the first demonstrations on January 25, 2011, along with the [[April 6 Youth Movement]], which marked the start of the [[Egyptian Revolution of 2011|Egyptian Revolution]].<ref name=conversation>{{cite web | url=http://socialistworker.org/2011/02/23/interview-with-egyptian-socialist | title=Conversation with an Egyptian socialist | publisher=Socialist Worker (US) | date=23 February 2011 | accessdate=26 February 2011}}</ref> Prominent members include journalist [[Hossam el-Hamalawy]]<ref name=hossam>{{cite web | url=http://mrzine.monthlyreview.org/2011/hamalawy080211.html | title=Revolution 2.0: Interview with Hossam el-Hamalawy | publisher=MRZine | date=8 February 2011 | accessdate=10 February 2011}}</ref> and activist [[Gigi Ibrahim]].<ref name=gigi>{{cite web | url=http://www.socialistworker.co.uk/art.php?id=24165 | title=Socialist from Egypt to join debate about revolution | publisher=Socialist Worker (UK) | date=12 March 2011 | accessdate=19 March 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748703561604576150604132131990.html | title=Splits Emerge Among Egypt's Young Activists | publisher=The Wall Street Journal | date=18 February 2011 | accessdate=15 March 2011}}</ref>
+
The '''Revolutionary Socialists''' ({{lang-ar|Ø§ÙØ§Ø´ØªØ±Ø§ÙÙÙÙ Ø§ÙØ«ÙØ±ÙÙÙ}}) (RS) are a [[revolutionary socialist]] organisation in [[Egypt]] aligned with the [[International Socialist Tendency]]. The RS produces a newspaper called ''[[The Socialist]]''.<ref name=Revolutionary>{{cite web | url=http://links.org.au/taxonomy/term/537 | title=Revolutionary Socialists (Egypt) | publisher=Links International Journal of Socialist Renewal | accessdate=7 February 2011}}</ref> They claim to have played a criticial role in mobilizing for the first demonstrations on January 25, 2011, along with the [[April 6 Youth Movement]], which marked the start of the [[Egyptian Revolution of 2011|Egyptian Revolution]].<ref name=conversation>{{cite web | url=http://socialistworker.org/2011/02/23/interview-with-egyptian-socialist | title=Conversation with an Egyptian socialist | publisher=Socialist Worker (US) | date=23 February 2011 | accessdate=26 February 2011}}</ref> Prominent members include journalist [[Hossam el-Hamalawy]]<ref name=hossam>{{cite web | url=http://mrzine.monthlyreview.org/2011/hamalawy080211.html | title=Revolution 2.0: Interview with Hossam el-Hamalawy | publisher=MRZine | date=8 February 2011 | accessdate=10 February 2011}}</ref> and activist [[Gigi Ibrahim]].<ref name=gigi>{{cite web | url=http://www.socialistworker.co.uk/art.php?id=24165 | title=Socialist from Egypt to join debate about revolution | publisher=Socialist Worker (UK) | date=12 March 2011 | accessdate=19 March 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=http://online.wsj.com/article/SB10001424052748703561604576150604132131990.html | title=Splits Emerge Among Egypt's Young Activists | publisher=The Wall Street Journal | date=18 February 2011 | accessdate=15 March 2011}}</ref>
